data.value: The array is zoomed using spline interpolation of the requested order.
, this function zooms the real and imaginary components independently.
The zoom factor along the axes. If a float,
is the same for each axis. If a sequence,
should contain one value for each axis.
The array in which to place the output, or the dtype of the returned array. By default an array of the same dtype as input will be created.
The order of the spline interpolation, default is 3. The order has to be in the range 0-5.
parameter determines how the input array is extended beyond its boundaries. Default is 'constant'. Behavior for each valid value is as follows (see additional plots and details on
The input is extended by reflecting about the edge of the last     pixel. This mode is also sometimes referred to as half-sample     symmetric.
d c b a | a b c d | d c b a
The input is extended by filling all values beyond the edge with     the same constant value, defined by the
parameter. No     interpolation is performed beyond the edges of the input.
k k k k | a b c d | k k k k
The input is extended by filling all values beyond the edge with     the same constant value, defined by the
parameter. Interpolation     occurs for samples outside the input's extent  as well.
k k k k | a b c d | k k k k
The input is extended by replicating the last pixel.
a a a a | a b c d | d d d d
The input is extended by reflecting about the center of the last     pixel. This mode is also sometimes referred to as whole-sample     symmetric.
d c b | a b c d | c b a
The input is extended by wrapping around to the opposite edge.
a b c d | a b c d | a b c d

The input is extended by wrapping around to the opposite edge, but in a     way such that the last point and initial point exactly overlap. In this     case it is not well defined which sample will be chosen at the point of     overlap.
d b c d | a b c d | b c a b
Value to fill past edges of input if
Determines if the input array is prefiltered with
before interpolation. The default is True, which will create a temporary
. If setting this to False, the output will be slightly blurred if
, unless the input is prefiltered, i.e. it is the result of calling
If False, the distance from the pixel centers is zoomed. Otherwise, the distance including the full pixel extent is used. For example, a 1d signal of length 5 is considered to have length 4 when
is True. See the following visual illustration:
The starting point of the arrow in the diagram above corresponds to coordinate location 0 in each mode.

signature.value: zoom(input, zoom, output=None, order=3, mode='constant', cval=0.0, prefilter=True, *, grid_mode=False)
